datasets.description: EROS assertions dataset for Dataform testing

views.description: creator_tier_assignments: critical fields present + valid ranges (today)
views.query:
SELECT *
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.creator_tier_assignments`
WHERE assignment_date = CURRENT_DATE()
  AND (
    username_std IS NULL OR
    full_tier_assignment IS NULL OR
    min_daily_messages IS NULL OR
    max_daily_messages IS NULL OR
    min_daily_messages > max_daily_messages
  )

SELECT c.*
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.creator_tier_assignments` c
WHERE LOWER(COALESCE(c.full_tier_assignment, '')) NOT IN (
  'a_free', 'a_paid',
  'b_free', 'b_paid',
  'c_free', 'c_paid',
  'd_free', 'd_paid',
  'enterprise', 'vip'
)
LIMIT 100

SELECT
  'sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)' AS failing_row_condition,
  *
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
WHERE NOT (sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY))
UNION ALL
SELECT
  'message_sk IS NOT NULL' AS failing_row_condition,
  *
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
WHERE NOT (message_sk IS NOT NULL)
UNION ALL
SELECT
  'sending_date IS NOT NULL' AS failing_row_condition,
  *
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
WHERE NOT (sending_date IS NOT NULL)
UNION ALL
SELECT
  'username_std IS NOT NULL' AS failing_row_condition,
  *
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
WHERE NOT (username_std IS NOT NULL)

SELECT
  *
FROM (
  SELECT
    message_sk,
    COUNT(1) AS index_row_count
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  GROUP BY message_sk
  ) AS data
WHERE index_row_count > 1

WITH s AS (
  SELECT MAX(sending_date) AS max_dt
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
)
SELECT *
FROM s
WHERE COALESCE(max_dt, DATE '1900-01-01') < DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 1 DAY)

WITH s AS (
  SELECT MAX(sending_date) AS max_dt
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
)
SELECT *
FROM s
WHERE COALESCE(max_dt, DATE '1900-01-01') < DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 1 DAY)

views.description: mass_messages: partitions present (>=1 row) for the last 14 days
views.query:
WITH days AS (
  SELECT d
  FROM UNNEST(GENERATE_DATE_ARRAY(DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 13 DAY), CURRENT_DATE())) d
),
observed AS (
  SELECT sending_date AS d
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date BETWEEN DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 13 DAY) AND CURRENT_DATE()
  GROUP BY d
)
SELECT days.d AS missing_partition_date
FROM days
LEFT JOIN observed USING (d)
WHERE observed.d IS NULL

views.description: Data quality checks for mass_messages table
views.query:
SELECT * FROM (
  -- Check 1: duplicate message_sk in the last 14 days
  SELECT
    'DUPLICATE_MESSAGE_SK' AS failing_row_condition,
    message_sk,
    COUNT(*) AS dup_count
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
  GROUP BY message_sk
  HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

  UNION ALL

  -- Check 2: NULL keys (should not happen)
  SELECT
    'NULL_KEYS' AS failing_row_condition,
    message_sk,
    1 AS cnt
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
    AND (message_sk IS NULL OR username_std IS NULL OR sending_date IS NULL)

  UNION ALL

  -- Check 3: Invalid date ranges
  SELECT
    'INVALID_DATES' AS failing_row_condition,
    message_sk,
    1 AS cnt
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
    AND (sending_date < DATE '2020-01-01' OR sending_date > DATE '2030-01-01')

  UNION ALL

  -- Check 4: Invalid prices
  SELECT
    'INVALID_PRICES' AS failing_row_condition,
    message_sk,
    1 AS cnt
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
    AND price IS NOT NULL
    AND (price < 0 OR price > 1000)
) AS failures

views.description: mass_messages: no duplicates after ROW_NUMBER() on 14 days
views.query:
WITH ranked AS (
  SELECT
    message_sk,
    loaded_at,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY message_sk ORDER BY loaded_at DESC) AS rn
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
)
SELECT *
FROM ranked
WHERE rn > 1

WITH d AS (
  SELECT message_sk
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
)
SELECT message_sk, COUNT(*) AS dup_cnt
FROM d
GROUP BY message_sk
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

views.description: Message surrogate keys must be unique
views.query:
SELECT message_sk, COUNT(*) as duplicate_count
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_stg.mass_messages`
WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 30 DAY)
GROUP BY message_sk
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

SELECT me.*
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.messages_enriched` me
WHERE me.sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
  AND LOWER(me.local_day_of_week) NOT IN (
    'monday','tuesday','wednesday','thursday','friday','saturday','sunday'
  )

WITH s AS (
  SELECT MAX(sending_date) AS max_dt
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.messages_enriched`
  WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
)
SELECT *
FROM s
WHERE COALESCE(max_dt, DATE '1900-01-01') < DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 1 DAY)

views.description: messages_enriched: critical fields not null (14d window)
views.query:
SELECT *
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.messages_enriched`
WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
  AND (username_std IS NULL OR sending_date IS NULL)
LIMIT 100

SELECT message_sk, COUNT(*) as dup_count
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.messages_enriched`
WHERE sending_date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 14 DAY)
GROUP BY message_sk
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

views.description: Price tier values must be from accepted list
views.query:
SELECT recommended_price_tier, COUNT(*) as invalid_count
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_pricing_feat.pricing_bands`
WHERE recommended_price_tier NOT IN ('LOW', 'MEDIUM', 'HIGH', 'PREMIUM')
GROUP BY recommended_price_tier
HAVING COUNT(*) > 0

WITH s AS (
  SELECT MAX(action_date) AS max_dt
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_ops.send_log`
)
SELECT *
FROM s
WHERE COALESCE(max_dt, DATE '1900-01-01') < DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 1 DAY)

views.description: send_log: partitions present for last 7 days (data-driven)
views.query:
WITH days AS (
  SELECT d
  FROM UNNEST(GENERATE_DATE_ARRAY(DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 6 DAY), CURRENT_DATE())) d
),
observed AS (
  SELECT action_date AS d
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_ops.send_log`
  WHERE action_date BETWEEN DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 6 DAY) AND CURRENT_DATE()
  GROUP BY d
)
SELECT days.d AS missing_partition_date
FROM days
LEFT JOIN observed USING (d)
WHERE observed.d IS NULL

WITH drip_mins AS (
  SELECT t.tier_id, ds.randomize_minutes AS rm
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.tier_baseline_templates` t, UNNEST(t.drip_schedule) ds
  WHERE ds.randomize_minutes IS NOT NULL
),
renewal_mins AS (
  SELECT t.tier_id, rs.randomize_minutes AS rm
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.tier_baseline_templates` t, UNNEST(t.renewal_schedule) rs
  WHERE rs.randomize_minutes IS NOT NULL
)
SELECT tier_id, rm
FROM drip_mins
WHERE NOT (rm BETWEEN 0 AND 1440)
UNION ALL
SELECT tier_id, rm
FROM renewal_mins
WHERE NOT (rm BETWEEN 0 AND 1440)

WITH base AS (
  SELECT
    m.sender AS creator_id,
    CAST(NULL AS STRING) AS action_type,         -- V1: type-agnostic
    TRIM(m.message) AS caption_text,

    -- Coerce strings to numeric
    SAFE_CAST(REPLACE(m.earnings,  '$', '') AS NUMERIC) AS revenue_usd,
    SAFE_CAST(m.purchased AS INT64)                     AS buyers,
    SAFE_CAST(m.viewed AS INT64)                        AS clicks,
    SAFE_CAST(m.sent AS INT64)                          AS impressions,
    SAFE_CAST(REPLACE(m.price,     '$', '') AS NUMERIC) AS price_usd,

    -- Resilient timestamp parsing (try several formats, then generic)
    COALESCE(
      SAFE.PARSE_TIMESTAMP('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%E*S%Ez', m.sending_time), -- with tz/frac sec
      SAFE.PARSE_TIMESTAMP('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S%Ez',  m.sending_time),
      SAFE.PARSE_TIMESTAMP('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S',     m.sending_time),
      SAFE.TIMESTAMP(m.sending_time)                                   -- generic fallback
    ) AS send_ts_raw
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_source.facts_messages_all` m
  WHERE m.message IS NOT NULL
),
filtered AS (
  SELECT
    creator_id,
    action_type,
    caption_text,
    revenue_usd, buyers, clicks, impressions, price_usd,
    send_ts_raw,
    DATETIME(send_ts_raw, 'America/Denver') AS sent_dt_mtz,
    CASE
      WHEN EXTRACT(HOUR FROM TIME(send_ts_raw, 'America/Denver')) BETWEEN 5  AND 10 THEN 'morning'
      WHEN EXTRACT(HOUR FROM TIME(send_ts_raw, 'America/Denver')) BETWEEN 11 AND 16 THEN 'day'
      WHEN EXTRACT(HOUR FROM TIME(send_ts_raw, 'America/Denver')) BETWEEN 17 AND 22 THEN 'evening'
      ELSE 'late'
    END AS time_of_day_tag
  FROM base
  WHERE send_ts_raw IS NOT NULL
    AND DATE(send_ts_raw) BETWEEN DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE('America/Denver'), INTERVAL 90 DAY)
                              AND CURRENT_DATE('America/Denver')
),
canon AS (
  SELECT
    creator_id,
    action_type,
    time_of_day_tag,
    caption_text,
    LOWER(REGEXP_REPLACE(caption_text, r'\s+', ' ')) AS caption_canonical,
    revenue_usd, buyers, clicks, impressions, price_usd, sent_dt_mtz
  FROM filtered
),
agg AS (
  SELECT
    creator_id,
    action_type,
    time_of_day_tag,
    caption_canonical,
    ANY_VALUE(SUBSTR(caption_canonical, 1, 500)) AS caption_preview,
    COUNT(*)                                      AS uses,
    COUNT(DISTINCT DATE(sent_dt_mtz))             AS days_used,
    MAX(sent_dt_mtz)                              AS last_used_mtz,
    SUM(revenue_usd)                              AS revenue_total_usd,
    SUM(buyers)                                   AS buyers_total,
    SUM(clicks)                                   AS clicks_total,
    SUM(impressions)                              AS impressions_total,
    APPROX_QUANTILES(price_usd, 100)[OFFSET(50)]  AS median_price_usd
  FROM canon
  GROUP BY 1,2,3,4
),
metrics AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    SAFE_DIVIDE(clicks_total, impressions_total)                 AS open_rate,   -- renamed (was ctr)
    SAFE_DIVIDE(revenue_total_usd, NULLIF(uses, 0))              AS rev_per_use,
    SAFE_DIVIDE(revenue_total_usd, NULLIF(impressions_total, 0)) AS rev_per_impr
  FROM agg
),
ranked AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
      PARTITION BY creator_id, action_type, time_of_day_tag
      ORDER BY revenue_total_usd DESC, rev_per_impr DESC, last_used_mtz DESC
    ) AS rank_within_bucket
  FROM metrics
)
SELECT
  creator_id,
  action_type,
  time_of_day_tag,
  caption_canonical AS caption_text,
  caption_preview,
  uses,
  days_used,
  last_used_mtz,
  revenue_total_usd,
  buyers_total,
  clicks_total,
  impressions_total,
  open_rate,
  rev_per_use,
  rev_per_impr,
  median_price_usd,
  rank_within_bucket
FROM ranked

SELECT
  cb.*,
  -- compatibility alias for downstream queries/UI that expect 'ctr'
  cb.open_rate AS ctr
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core.vw_caption_bank` cb
JOIN `of-scheduler-proj.eros_source.scheduler_assignments_final` a
  ON LOWER(TRIM(a.username_std)) = LOWER(TRIM(cb.creator_id))
WHERE LOWER(a.scheduler_email) = LOWER(SESSION_USER())

SELECT
  COUNT(*) AS rows_horizon,
  COUNTIF(fatigue_risk_band = 'HIGH') AS high_fatigue_horizon
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1_report`
WHERE TIMESTAMP_DIFF(recommended_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) BETWEEN 24 AND 30

SELECT
  rec_id,
  creator_id,
  plan_date,
  recommended_time,
  recommended_price_usd,
  -- TODO: replace <FORM_ID> with your Google Form ID
  CONCAT(
    'https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/<FORM_ID>/viewform?usp=pp_url',
    '&entry.rec_id=',  CAST(rec_id AS STRING),
    '&entry.creator=', creator_id,
    '&entry.plan_date=', CAST(plan_date AS STRING),
    '&entry.time=', CAST(recommended_time AS STRING),
    '&entry.price=', CAST(recommended_price_usd AS STRING),
    '&entry.action=ACCEPTED'
  ) AS link_accept,
  CONCAT(
    'https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/<FORM_ID>/viewform?usp=pp_url',
    '&entry.rec_id=',  CAST(rec_id AS STRING),
    '&entry.creator=', creator_id,
    '&entry.plan_date=', CAST(plan_date AS STRING),
    '&entry.time=', CAST(recommended_time AS STRING),
    '&entry.price=', CAST(recommended_price_usd AS STRING),
    '&entry.action=EDIT'
  ) AS link_edit,
  CONCAT(
    'https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/<FORM_ID>/viewform?usp=pp_url',
    '&entry.rec_id=',  CAST(rec_id AS STRING),
    '&entry.creator=', creator_id,
    '&entry.plan_date=', CAST(plan_date AS STRING),
    '&entry.time=', CAST(recommended_time AS STRING),
    '&entry.price=', CAST(recommended_price_usd AS STRING),
    '&entry.action=OVERRIDE'
  ) AS link_override
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1`

SELECT
  c.creator_id,
  c.plan_date,
  -- WINDOWS (local time). Use in LS CASE expressions:
  -- morning: 05-10, day: 11-16, evening: 17-22, late: 23-04
  -- Counts for planned sends by window (approximate with recommended_time)
  COUNTIF(EXTRACT(HOUR FROM c.recommended_time) BETWEEN 5  AND 10) AS planned_morning_cnt,
  COUNTIF(EXTRACT(HOUR FROM c.recommended_time) BETWEEN 17 AND 22) AS planned_evening_cnt,
  -- Placeholder NULLs for items not yet in the mart (LS will show "—")
  CAST(NULL AS BOOL) AS has_renew_8_4_12,
  CAST(NULL AS BOOL) AS has_wall_post,
  CAST(NULL AS BOOL) AS deletions_done,
  CAST(NULL AS BOOL) AS ppv_variety_ok,
  CAST(NULL AS BOOL) AS link_drops_done,
  -- variety today (very simple: distinct minute count)
  COUNT(DISTINCT FORMAT_TIME('%H:%M', c.recommended_time)) >= 3 AS variety_today_ok
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1_rbac` c
GROUP BY 1,2

WITH horizon AS (
  SELECT *
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1_report`
  WHERE TIMESTAMP_DIFF(recommended_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) BETWEEN 24 AND 30
)
SELECT
  creator_id,
  DATE(recommended_ts_mtz) AS plan_date_horizon,
  COUNTIF(EXTRACT(HOUR FROM recommended_time) BETWEEN 5  AND 10) AS horizon_morning_cnt,
  COUNTIF(EXTRACT(HOUR FROM recommended_time) BETWEEN 17 AND 22) AS horizon_evening_cnt,
  COUNT(DISTINCT FORMAT_TIME('%H:%M', recommended_time)) >= 3    AS horizon_variety_ok
FROM horizon
GROUP BY 1,2
SELECT * FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core_dim.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1`

SELECT *
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1`
WHERE LOWER(scheduler_email) = LOWER(SESSION_USER())

SELECT
  rec_id,
  creator_id,
  plan_date,
  scheduler_email,
  action_type,
  recommended_time,
  recommended_price_usd,
  expected_revenue_usd,
  expected_revenue_low_usd,
  expected_revenue_high_usd,
  confidence,
  model_version,
  view_refreshed_at,
  fatigue_score,
  fatigue_trend_30d,
  fatigue_risk_band,
  ARRAY_LENGTH(events) AS events_count,
  reason_time_code,
  reason_price_code,
  CASE
    WHEN EXTRACT(HOUR FROM recommended_time) BETWEEN 5  AND 10 THEN 'morning'
    WHEN EXTRACT(HOUR FROM recommended_time) BETWEEN 11 AND 16 THEN 'day'
    WHEN EXTRACT(HOUR FROM recommended_time) BETWEEN 17 AND 22 THEN 'evening'
    ELSE 'late'
  END AS time_of_day_tag,
  -- ensure we always expose recommended_ts_mtz
  recommended_ts_mtz,
  due_in_hours,
  due_chip,

  -- NEW: lead-time fields for advance scheduling
  TIMESTAMP_DIFF(recommended_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) AS lead_time_hours,
  CONCAT('T-', CAST(ABS(TIMESTAMP_DIFF(recommended_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR)) AS STRING), 'h') AS lead_time_chip,
  CASE
    WHEN TIMESTAMP_DIFF(recommended_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) < 0  THEN 'past'
    WHEN TIMESTAMP_DIFF(recommended_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) <= 18 THEN 'urgent'
    WHEN TIMESTAMP_DIFF(recommended_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) <= 30 THEN 'in-window'
    WHEN TIMESTAMP_DIFF(recommended_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) <= 72 THEN 'upcoming'
    ELSE 'later'
  END AS lead_time_band
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1`

WITH w AS (
  SELECT
    rec_id,
    creator_id,
    plan_date,
    scheduler_email,
    recommended_time,
    recommended_price_usd,
    fatigue_risk_band,
    reason_time_code,
    due_in_hours
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1_rbac`
)
SELECT
  creator_id,
  scheduler_email,
  plan_date,
  CONCAT(FORMAT_TIME('%H:%M', recommended_time),' | $',CAST(recommended_price_usd AS STRING)) AS cell_text,
  fatigue_risk_band,
  reason_time_code,
  due_in_hours
FROM w

views.description: 7-day weekly slots with scheduler RBAC assignments
views.query:
WITH next_7_days AS (
  SELECT date_val as plan_date
  FROM UNNEST(GENERATE_DATE_ARRAY(
    CURRENT_DATE('America/New_York'),
    DATE_ADD(CURRENT_DATE('America/New_York'), INTERVAL 6 DAY)
  )) as date_val
),

scheduler_creator_mapping AS (
  SELECT
    sa.scheduler_code,
    sa.username_std as creator_id
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_source.scheduler_assignments` sa
  WHERE sa.scheduler_code IS NOT NULL
    AND sa.username_std IS NOT NULL
),

extended_recommendations AS (
  SELECT
    dr.username_std as creator_id,
    dr.recommendation_date,
    TIMESTAMP_TRUNC(dr.recommended_send_ts, HOUR) as recommended_time,
    CASE
      WHEN dr.price_tier = 'High' THEN 'PPV'
      WHEN dr.price_tier = 'Medium' THEN 'PPV'
      ELSE 'PPV'
    END as action_type,
    dr.suggested_price as recommended_price_usd,
    CASE
      WHEN dr.fatigue_safety_score >= 70 THEN 'LOW'
      WHEN dr.fatigue_safety_score >= 40 THEN 'MEDIUM'
      ELSE 'HIGH'
    END as fatigue_risk_band,
    CONCAT(
      CASE
        WHEN EXTRACT(DAYOFWEEK FROM dr.recommendation_date) IN (1, 7) THEN 'WE_'
        WHEN EXTRACT(DAYOFWEEK FROM dr.recommendation_date) IN (2, 6) THEN 'HI_'
        ELSE 'MED_'
      END,
      FORMAT('%02d', EXTRACT(HOUR FROM dr.recommended_send_ts)),
      '_',
      CASE
        WHEN dr.fatigue_safety_score >= 70 THEN 'SAFE'
        WHEN dr.fatigue_safety_score >= 40 THEN 'CAUTION'
        ELSE 'RISK'
      END
    ) as reason_time_code
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_mart.daily_recommendations` dr
  WHERE dr.recommendation_rank = 1  -- Best recommendation per creator
),

-- Generate slots for all 7 days for each creator
all_creator_days AS (
  SELECT
    scm.scheduler_code,
    scm.creator_id,
    nd.plan_date
  FROM scheduler_creator_mapping scm
  CROSS JOIN next_7_days nd
),

final_slots AS (
  SELECT
    acd.scheduler_code,
    acd.creator_id,
    acd.plan_date,
    COALESCE(er.recommended_time,
      TIMESTAMP_ADD(TIMESTAMP(acd.plan_date), INTERVAL (10 + MOD(ABS(FARM_FINGERPRINT(CONCAT(acd.creator_id, acd.plan_date))), 12)) HOUR)
    ) as recommended_time,
    COALESCE(er.action_type, 'PPV') as action_type,
    COALESCE(er.recommended_price_usd, 19.99) as recommended_price_usd,
    COALESCE(er.fatigue_risk_band, 'MEDIUM') as fatigue_risk_band,
    COALESCE(er.reason_time_code, 'DEFAULT_TIMING') as reason_time_code
  FROM all_creator_days acd
  LEFT JOIN extended_recommendations er
    ON acd.creator_id = er.creator_id
    AND acd.plan_date = er.recommendation_date
)

SELECT
  scheduler_code,
  creator_id,
  plan_date,
  recommended_time,
  action_type,
  recommended_price_usd,
  fatigue_risk_band,
  reason_time_code
FROM final_slots
ORDER BY scheduler_code, creator_id, plan_date

datasets.description: Core dimension tables for EROS intelligence engine

tables.description: Authoritative creator timezone mapping (IANA)

views.query:
WITH
base AS (
  SELECT
    -- unique id per creator+date+time (avoid collisions)
    FARM_FINGERPRINT(CONCAT(
      dr.username_std, '|',
      CAST(dr.recommendation_date AS STRING), '|',
      FORMAT_TIME('%H:%M:%S', EXTRACT(TIME FROM dr.recommended_send_ts))
    )) AS rec_id,

    dr.username_std                      AS creator_id,
    dr.recommendation_date               AS plan_date,
    EXTRACT(TIME FROM dr.recommended_send_ts) AS recommended_time,
    dr.suggested_price                   AS recommended_price_usd,

    -- Placeholders nulled to avoid misleading UI in V1
    NULL AS action_type,
    NULL AS expected_revenue_usd,
    NULL AS expected_revenue_low_usd,
    NULL AS expected_revenue_high_usd,
    NULL AS confidence,
    NULL AS model_version,

    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AS view_refreshed_at,

    -- Base timestamp in local tz for countdowns and alt-hour computations
    TIMESTAMP(
      DATETIME(dr.recommendation_date, EXTRACT(TIME FROM dr.recommended_send_ts)),
      'America/Denver'
    ) AS base_ts_mtz
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_mart.daily_recommendations` dr
  WHERE dr.recommendation_date BETWEEN DATE(CURRENT_DATE('America/Denver'))
    AND DATE_ADD(CURRENT_DATE('America/Denver'), INTERVAL 6 DAY)
),

feat AS (
  SELECT
    fs.username_std AS creator_id,
    fs.score_date   AS plan_date,
    ANY_VALUE(fs.fatigue_risk_score) AS fatigue_score,
    NULL AS fatigue_trend_30d  -- not available yet
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_ops_feat.fatigue_scores` fs
  WHERE fs.score_date BETWEEN DATE(CURRENT_DATE('America/Denver'))
    AND DATE_ADD(CURRENT_DATE('America/Denver'), INTERVAL 6 DAY)
  GROUP BY 1,2
),

-- 🚨 Critical fix: source has day names ("Sunday".."Saturday"), map to BigQuery's 1..7
heat AS (
  SELECT
    hm.username_std AS creator_id,
    CASE
      WHEN hm.local_day_of_week = 'Sunday'    THEN 1
      WHEN hm.local_day_of_week = 'Monday'    THEN 2
      WHEN hm.local_day_of_week = 'Tuesday'   THEN 3
      WHEN hm.local_day_of_week = 'Wednesday' THEN 4
      WHEN hm.local_day_of_week = 'Thursday'  THEN 5
      WHEN hm.local_day_of_week = 'Friday'    THEN 6
      WHEN hm.local_day_of_week = 'Saturday'  THEN 7
    END AS dow,                      -- 1..7
    hm.local_hour        AS hour_of_day,     -- 0..23
    hm.avg_rpm           AS hour_perf_index
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_feat.creator_heatmap` hm
),

-- Pricing bands intentionally nulled in V1 to avoid misleading UI
price AS (
  SELECT
    pb.username_std AS creator_id,
    NULL AS action_type,
    NULL AS price_band_label,
    NULL AS price_band_index
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_pricing_feat.pricing_bands` pb
  GROUP BY 1
),

assign AS (
  SELECT
    username_std   AS creator_id,
    scheduler_email
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_source.scheduler_assignments_final`
),

events_raw AS (
  SELECT
    creator_id,
    DATE(start_ts) AS plan_date,
    ARRAY_AGG(STRUCT(event_type, title, start_ts, end_ts) ORDER BY start_ts) AS events
  FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_source.creator_calendar`
  WHERE DATE(start_ts) BETWEEN DATE(CURRENT_DATE('America/Denver'))
    AND DATE_ADD(CURRENT_DATE('America/Denver'), INTERVAL 6 DAY)
  GROUP BY 1,2
),

joined AS (
  SELECT
    b.*,
    a.scheduler_email,
    f.fatigue_score,
    f.fatigue_trend_30d,
    p.price_band_label,
    p.price_band_index,
    COALESCE(
      e.events,
      ARRAY<STRUCT<event_type STRING, title STRING, start_ts TIMESTAMP, end_ts TIMESTAMP>>[]
    ) AS events
  FROM base b
  LEFT JOIN assign     a USING (creator_id)
  LEFT JOIN feat       f USING (creator_id, plan_date)
  LEFT JOIN price      p USING (creator_id)
  LEFT JOIN events_raw e USING (creator_id, plan_date)
),

reasoning AS (
  SELECT
    j.*,
    CASE
      WHEN j.price_band_index IS NULL THEN NULL
      WHEN j.price_band_index >= 0.75 THEN 'PRICE:P75+'
      WHEN j.price_band_index >= 0.50 THEN 'PRICE:P50-75'
      WHEN j.price_band_index >= 0.25 THEN 'PRICE:P25-50'
      ELSE 'PRICE:P<=25'
    END AS reason_price_code,
    CASE
      WHEN h.hour_perf_index >= 0.90 THEN 'TIME:P90'
      WHEN h.hour_perf_index >= 0.75 THEN 'TIME:P75'
      WHEN h.hour_perf_index >= 0.50 THEN 'TIME:P50'
      ELSE 'TIME:BASE'
    END AS reason_time_code
  FROM joined j
  LEFT JOIN heat h
    ON h.creator_id = j.creator_id
   AND h.dow        = EXTRACT(DAYOFWEEK FROM j.plan_date)   -- 1..7
   AND h.hour_of_day = EXTRACT(HOUR FROM j.recommended_time) -- 0..23
),

alts AS (
  SELECT
    r.rec_id,
    ARRAY(
      SELECT AS STRUCT
        'RECOMMENDED' AS alt_rank,
        EXTRACT(HOUR FROM r.recommended_time) AS hour_of_day,
        r.recommended_time                    AS alt_time,
        r.recommended_price_usd               AS alt_price_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_low_usd            AS alt_rev_low_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_usd                AS alt_rev_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_high_usd           AS alt_rev_high_usd,
        r.confidence                          AS alt_confidence
      UNION ALL
      SELECT AS STRUCT
        'ALT_PREV_HOUR' AS alt_rank,
        MOD(EXTRACT(HOUR FROM r.recommended_time) + 23, 24) AS hour_of_day,
        TIME(TIMESTAMP_SUB(r.base_ts_mtz, INTERVAL 1 HOUR), 'America/Denver') AS alt_time,
        r.recommended_price_usd AS alt_price_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_low_usd  * COALESCE( (COALESCE(prev_h.hour_perf_index, 0.90) / NULLIF(curr_h.hour_perf_index, 0.0)), 0.90 ) AS alt_rev_low_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_usd      * COALESCE( (COALESCE(prev_h.hour_perf_index, 0.90) / NULLIF(curr_h.hour_perf_index, 0.0)), 0.90 ) AS alt_rev_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_high_usd * COALESCE( (COALESCE(prev_h.hour_perf_index, 0.90) / NULLIF(curr_h.hour_perf_index, 0.0)), 0.90 ) AS alt_rev_high_usd,
        r.confidence AS alt_confidence
      UNION ALL
      SELECT AS STRUCT
        'ALT_NEXT_HOUR' AS alt_rank,
        MOD(EXTRACT(HOUR FROM r.recommended_time) + 1, 24) AS hour_of_day,
        TIME(TIMESTAMP_ADD(r.base_ts_mtz, INTERVAL 1 HOUR), 'America/Denver') AS alt_time,
        r.recommended_price_usd AS alt_price_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_low_usd  * COALESCE( (COALESCE(next_h.hour_perf_index, 0.95) / NULLIF(curr_h.hour_perf_index, 0.0)), 0.95 ) AS alt_rev_low_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_usd      * COALESCE( (COALESCE(next_h.hour_perf_index, 0.95) / NULLIF(curr_h.hour_perf_index, 0.0)), 0.95 ) AS alt_rev_usd,
        r.expected_revenue_high_usd * COALESCE( (COALESCE(next_h.hour_perf_index, 0.95) / NULLIF(curr_h.hour_perf_index, 0.0)), 0.95 ) AS alt_rev_high_usd,
        r.confidence AS alt_confidence
    ) AS top3_alternatives
  FROM reasoning r
  LEFT JOIN heat curr_h
    ON curr_h.creator_id = r.creator_id
   AND curr_h.dow        = EXTRACT(DAYOFWEEK FROM r.plan_date)
   AND curr_h.hour_of_day = EXTRACT(HOUR FROM r.recommended_time)
  LEFT JOIN heat prev_h
    ON prev_h.creator_id = r.creator_id
   AND prev_h.dow        = EXTRACT(DAYOFWEEK FROM r.plan_date)
   AND prev_h.hour_of_day = MOD(EXTRACT(HOUR FROM r.recommended_time) + 23, 24)
  LEFT JOIN heat next_h
    ON next_h.creator_id = r.creator_id
   AND next_h.dow        = EXTRACT(DAYOFWEEK FROM r.plan_date)
   AND next_h.hour_of_day = MOD(EXTRACT(HOUR FROM r.recommended_time) + 1, 24)
),

final AS (
  SELECT
    r.*,
    CASE
      WHEN r.fatigue_score >= 0.80 THEN 'HIGH'
      WHEN r.fatigue_score >= 0.60 THEN 'MED'
      ELSE 'LOW'
    END AS fatigue_risk_band,
    a.top3_alternatives,
    -- countdowns
    TIMESTAMP_DIFF(r.base_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) AS due_in_hours,
    FORMAT('%s %s',
      CASE WHEN TIMESTAMP_DIFF(r.base_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR) < 0 THEN 'Started'
           ELSE 'Due in' END,
      CONCAT(CAST(ABS(TIMESTAMP_DIFF(r.base_ts_mtz, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP(), HOUR)) AS STRING), 'h')
    ) AS due_chip
  FROM reasoning r
  LEFT JOIN alts a USING (rec_id)
)

SELECT
  rec_id,
  creator_id,
  plan_date,
  scheduler_email,
  action_type,
  recommended_time,
  recommended_price_usd,
  expected_revenue_usd,
  expected_revenue_low_usd,
  expected_revenue_high_usd,
  confidence,
  model_version,
  view_refreshed_at,
  fatigue_score,
  fatigue_trend_30d,
  fatigue_risk_band,
  events,
  reason_time_code,
  reason_price_code,
  top3_alternatives,
  base_ts_mtz AS recommended_ts_mtz,
  due_in_hours,
  due_chip
FROM final

SELECT *
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_core_dim.vw_scheduler_cockpit_v1`
WHERE LOWER(scheduler_email) = LOWER(SESSION_USER())

views.description: Scheduler dashboard summary combining enhanced recommendations with roster context
views.query:
SELECT
  sa.scheduler_code,
  sa.scheduler_display_name,
  sa.scheduler_email,
  sa.group_email,
  r.username_std,
  r.message_type,
  r.message_subtype,
  r.recommended_send_ts,
  r.recommendation_rank,
  r.opportunity_quality,
  r.price_tier,
  r.suggested_price,
  r.recommendation_reason,
  CASE
    WHEN r.fatigue_safety_score < 30 THEN '🔴 HIGH FATIGUE RISK'
    WHEN r.fatigue_safety_score < 60 THEN '🟡 MODERATE FATIGUE'
    ELSE '🟢 SAFE TO SEND'
  END AS fatigue_status,
  CASE
    WHEN r.recommendation_score >= 0.8 THEN '⭐⭐⭐ EXCELLENT'
    WHEN r.recommendation_score >= 0.6 THEN '⭐⭐ GOOD'
    WHEN r.recommendation_score >= 0.4 THEN '⭐ FAIR'
    ELSE '⚠️ LOW CONFIDENCE'
  END AS opportunity_summary
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_messaging_mart.enhanced_daily_recommendations` r
JOIN `of-scheduler-proj.eros_source.scheduler_assignments` sa
  ON r.username_std = sa.username_std
WHERE r.recommendation_date = CURRENT_DATE()
  AND (r.is_mandatory OR r.recommendation_rank <= 3)
ORDER BY sa.scheduler_code, r.recommended_send_ts

tables.description: Caption bank data for content analysis and optimization

views.query:
SELECT
  CAST(NULL AS STRING)   AS creator_id,
  CAST(NULL AS TIMESTAMP) AS start_ts,
  CAST(NULL AS TIMESTAMP) AS end_ts,
  CAST(NULL AS STRING)   AS event_type,
  CAST(NULL AS STRING)   AS title
LIMIT 0

SELECT
  message_id,
  username_std,
  message_type,
  sent_at_utc,
  DATE(sent_at_utc, 'America/Denver') AS date_local,
  EXTRACT(HOUR FROM sent_at_utc AT TIME ZONE 'America/Denver') AS hod_local,
  price_usd, status,
  impressions, buyers, revenue_usd,
  caption_text,
  LOWER(REGEXP_REPLACE(IFNULL(caption_text,''), r'\s+', ' ')) AS caption_key
FROM `of-scheduler-proj.eros_source.facts_messages_all`
